TextBody:
Hi Ivan,

We are still waiting for our R&D Team to let us know the next step here.

Emil is out of office until Monday, but I just followed up internally on this and will keep you posted on any update we get.

Thank you and best regards,

__________________
Cristian Tornea
Senior Technical Support Engineer & Shift Lead  (US/Canada/LATAM)
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
 

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | Enforced Encryption | eDiscovery

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #424405 -  - Problems deleting Shadow files    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HCkdF:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello Ivan,

We are still working in order to address this issue in one of the next server updates.

Until the issue will be addressed with a server update, my colleagues recommended to start an Audit Log Backup for the Content Aware Logs so the server will remove some of the old CAP logs.
When the CAP log number gets under 2 partitions (2 million logs) a cron script will add some fields to the "cf_log" table in the database. After the script will update the table, the files can be manually removed.
The cron script should run automatically at 23:00 (there is no need for intervention in order to start it). 
After the cron script runs, there will be no more errors on the File Maintenance delete action.

If you need to keep the logs and you don't want to backup and remove more recent logs, we can remotely connect again and I can remove the fileshadows from the backend.

Best regards,
Emil

Para: MEJIA Ivan - WIZLYNXGROUP <ivan.mejia@loreal.com>
Asunto: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #424405 - - Problems deleting Shadow files [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HCkdF:ref ]

EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT

Hello Ivan,

We are still working in order to address this issue in one of the next server updates.

Until the issue will be addressed with a server update, my colleagues recommended to start an Audit Log Backup for the Content Aware Logs so the server will remove some of the old CAP logs.
When the CAP log number gets under 2 partitions (2 million logs) a cron script will add some fields to the "cf_log" table in the database. After the script will update the table, the files can be manually removed.
The cron script should run automatically at 23:00 (there is no need for intervention in order to start it).
After the cron script runs, there will be no more errors on the File Maintenance delete action.

If you need to keep the logs and you don't want to backup and remove more recent logs, we can remotely connect again and I can remove the fileshadows from the backend.

Best regards,
Emil

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #424405 -  - Problems deleting Shadow files    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HCkdF:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello Ivan,

Let me know if we can have a remote session tomorrow in order to further discuss about this and setup the audit log backup together.

As the backup is set in your screenshot, it will backup and remove all the logs from the server.
I would recommend to backup only some of the logs. For example you can backup the logs older than 6 months instead of backing up all of the logs.

I would do it as in the following screenshot:


Best regards,
Emil



--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: MEJIA Ivan - WIZLYNXGROUP [ivan.mejia@loreal.com]
Sent: 11/27/2024 7:12 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #424405 - - Problems deleting Shadow files [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HCkdF:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000HCkdF:ref



Hi Emil, thanks for the update, so I will make a backup, is this the correct way in this case?:

 



 

Thanks,

 

Regards,

 



	
		
			
			
			
			
			Ivan MEJIA - WIZLYNXGROUP

			External consultant
			
		
	


 

“We work flexibly at L’Oréal. I’m sending this email now because it suits me. I don’t expect that you will read, respond to or action it outside of your usual hours.”




 



 

C1 - Internal use
De: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Enviado el: miércoles, 27 de noviembre de 2024 10:51
Para: MEJIA Ivan - WIZLYNXGROUP <ivan.mejia@loreal.com>
Asunto: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #424405 - - Problems deleting Shadow files [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HCkdF:ref ]

 



 




	
		
			
			EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT
			
		
	



 


Hello Ivan,

We are still working in order to address this issue in one of the next server updates.

Until the issue will be addressed with a server update, my colleagues recommended to start an Audit Log Backup for the Content Aware Logs so the server will remove some of the old CAP logs.
When the CAP log number gets under 2 partitions (2 million logs) a cron script will add some fields to the "cf_log" table in the database. After the script will update the table, the files can be manually removed.
The cron script should run automatically at 23:00 (there is no need for intervention in order to start it). 
After the cron script runs, there will be no more errors on the File Maintenance delete action.

If you need to keep the logs and you don't want to backup and remove more recent logs, we can remotely connect again and I can remove the fileshadows from the backend.

Best regards,
Emil

Asunto: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #424405 - - Problems deleting Shadow files [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HCkdF:ref ]



EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT

Hello Ivan,

We are still working in order to address this issue in one of the next server updates.

Until the issue will be addressed with a server update, my colleagues recommended to start an Audit Log Backup for the Content Aware Logs so the server will remove some of the old CAP logs.
When the CAP log number gets under 2 partitions (2 million logs) a cron script will add some fields to the "cf_log" table in the database. After the script will update the table, the files can be manually removed.
The cron script should run automatically at 23:00 (there is no need for intervention in order to start it).
After the cron script runs, there will be no more errors on the File Maintenance delete action.

If you need to keep the logs and you don't want to backup and remove more recent logs, we can remotely connect again and I can remove the fileshadows from the backend.

Best regards,
Emil

Hello Ivan,

Let me know if we can have a remote session tomorrow in order to further discuss about this and setup the audit log backup together.

As the backup is set in your screenshot, it will backup and remove all the logs from the server.
I would recommend to backup only some of the logs. For example you can backup the logs older than 6 months instead of backing up all of the logs.

I would do it as in the following screenshot:


Best regards,
Emil



--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: MEJIA Ivan - WIZLYNXGROUP [ivan.mejia@loreal.com]
Sent: 11/27/2024 7:12 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #424405 - - Problems deleting Shadow files [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HCkdF:ref ]

Thanks,

 

Regards,

 



	
		
			
			
			
			
			Ivan MEJIA - WIZLYNXGROUP

			External consultant
			
		
	


 

“We work flexibly at L’Oréal. I’m sending this email now because it suits me. I don’t expect that you will read, respond to or action it outside of your usual hours.”




 



 

C1 - Internal use

De: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Enviado el: miércoles, 27 de noviembre de 2024 10:51
Para: MEJIA Ivan - WIZLYNXGROUP <ivan.mejia@loreal.com>
Asunto: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #424405 - - Problems deleting Shadow files [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HCkdF:ref ] 

 



 




	
		
			
			EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT
			
		
	



 


Hello Ivan,

We are still working in order to address this issue in one of the next server updates.

Until the issue will be addressed with a server update, my colleagues recommended to start an Audit Log Backup for the Content Aware Logs so the server will remove some of the old CAP logs.
When the CAP log number gets under 2 partitions (2 million logs) a cron script will add some fields to the "cf_log" table in the database. After the script will update the table, the files can be manually removed.
The cron script should run automatically at 23:00 (there is no need for intervention in order to start it). 
After the cron script runs, there will be no more errors on the File Maintenance delete action.

If you need to keep the logs and you don't want to backup and remove more recent logs, we can remotely connect again and I can remove the fileshadows from the backend.

Best regards,
Emil

EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT

Hello Ivan,

We are still working in order to address this issue in one of the next server updates.

Until the issue will be addressed with a server update, my colleagues recommended to start an Audit Log Backup for the Content Aware Logs so the server will remove some of the old CAP logs.
When the CAP log number gets under 2 partitions (2 million logs) a cron script will add some fields to the "cf_log" table in the database. After the script will update the table, the files can be manually removed.
The cron script should run automatically at 23:00 (there is no need for intervention in order to start it).
After the cron script runs, there will be no more errors on the File Maintenance delete action.

If you need to keep the logs and you don't want to backup and remove more recent logs, we can remotely connect again and I can remove the fileshadows from the backend.

Best regards,
Emil

EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT

Hello Ivan,

We are still working in order to address this issue in one of the next server updates.

Until the issue will be addressed with a server update, my colleagues recommended to start an Audit Log Backup for the Content Aware Logs so the server will remove some of the old CAP logs.
When the CAP log number gets under 2 partitions (2 million logs) a cron script will add some fields to the "cf_log" table in the database. After the script will update the table, the files can be manually removed.
The cron script should run automatically at 23:00 (there is no need for intervention in order to start it).
After the cron script runs, there will be no more errors on the File Maintenance delete action.

If you need to keep the logs and you don't want to backup and remove more recent logs, we can remotely connect again and I can remove the fileshadows from the backend.

Best regards,
Emil

			EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT
			
		
	



 


Hello Ivan,

We are still working in order to address this issue in one of the next server updates.

Until the issue will be addressed with a server update, my colleagues recommended to start an Audit Log Backup for the Content Aware Logs so the server will remove some of the old CAP logs.
When the CAP log number gets under 2 partitions (2 million logs) a cron script will add some fields to the "cf_log" table in the database. After the script will update the table, the files can be manually removed.
The cron script should run automatically at 23:00 (there is no need for intervention in order to start it). 
After the cron script runs, there will be no more errors on the File Maintenance delete action.

If you need to keep the logs and you don't want to backup and remove more recent logs, we can remotely connect again and I can remove the fileshadows from the backend.

Best regards,
Emil

			EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT
			
		
	



 


Hello Ivan,

We are still working in order to address this issue in one of the next server updates.

Until the issue will be addressed with a server update, my colleagues recommended to start an Audit Log Backup for the Content Aware Logs so the server will remove some of the old CAP logs.
When the CAP log number gets under 2 partitions (2 million logs) a cron script will add some fields to the "cf_log" table in the database. After the script will update the table, the files can be manually removed.
The cron script should run automatically at 23:00 (there is no need for intervention in order to start it). 
After the cron script runs, there will be no more errors on the File Maintenance delete action.

If you need to keep the logs and you don't want to backup and remove more recent logs, we can remotely connect again and I can remove the fileshadows from the backend.

Best regards,
Emil

EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT

Hello Ivan,

We are still working in order to address this issue in one of the next server updates.

Until the issue will be addressed with a server update, my colleagues recommended to start an Audit Log Backup for the Content Aware Logs so the server will remove some of the old CAP logs.
When the CAP log number gets under 2 partitions (2 million logs) a cron script will add some fields to the "cf_log" table in the database. After the script will update the table, the files can be manually removed.
The cron script should run automatically at 23:00 (there is no need for intervention in order to start it).
After the cron script runs, there will be no more errors on the File Maintenance delete action.

If you need to keep the logs and you don't want to backup and remove more recent logs, we can remotely connect again and I can remove the fileshadows from the backend.

Best regards,
Emil
